  • Constructor Details

    • File

      public File(String name, int size, boolean writable)
      Constructor to create a File object with a name, size and write permissions.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the file.
      size - The size of the file.
      writable - Whether you want the file to be writable (permissions).

    • File

      public File(String name)
      Constructor to create a File object with a name. The size will be set to 0.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the file.

  • Method Details

    • setWritable

      public void setWritable(boolean writable)
      Set the writable variable when creating the file.
      Parameters:
      writable - Whether you want the file to be able to change size and name.

    • isWritable

      public boolean isWritable()
      Get the writable boolean of the file
      Returns:
      writable Whether the file can change name and file size.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Get the name of the file.
      Returns:
      name The name of the file.

      Set the initial date when creating the file.

      Set the date when changing a file.

    • setSize

      public void setSize(int size)
      Sets the size of the file to the given size in bytes
      Parameters:
      size - the new size for the file
      Preconditions:
      the given size must be valid 
      isValidSize(size)

    • getSize

      public int getSize()

    • canHaveAsSize

      public boolean canHaveAsSize(int size)
      Return a boolean reflecting whether the given size is valid
      Parameters:
      size - the size needed to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the given size is not negative and is not larger than the maximum size 
      result == ((size >= 0) && (size <= getMaxSize()))

    • enlarge

      public void enlarge(int amount)
      Enlages the size of the file with the given amount.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount of bytes needed to be add to the size
      Preconditions:
      the amount must be valid and accepted for enlargment 
      canAcceptForEnlarge(amount)
      Postconditions:
      The new size of this file is equal to the old size incremented with the given amount of bytes. 
      new.getSize() = this.getSize() + amount

    • canAcceptForEnlarge

      public boolean canAcceptForEnlarge(int amount)
      Returns a boolean reflecting whether the given amount is accepted to enlarge the size of the file
      Parameters:
      amount - amount of bytes needed to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the given amount is not negative, the file is writable and ...

    • shorten

      public void shorten(int amount)
      Shortens the size of the file with the given amount.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount of bytes to reduce the size
      Preconditions:
      the amount must be valid and accepted for shortening 
      canAcceptForShorten(amount)
      Postconditions:
      The new size of this file is equal to the old size reduced with the given amount of bytes. 
      new.getSize() = this.getSize() - amount

    • canAcceptForShorten

      public boolean canAcceptForShorten(int amount)
      Returns a boolean reflecting whether the given amount is accepted to shorten the size of the file
      Parameters:
      amount - amount of bytes needed to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the given amount is not negative, the file is writable and ...

    • hasOverLappingUsePeriod

      public boolean hasOverLappingUsePeriod(File file)
      Check if the file has an overlapping use period with another file.
      Parameters:
      file - The other file.
      Returns:
      True or false.

    • checkName

      private boolean checkName(String name)
      Checks if the input name is a valid name that can be used.
      Parameters:
      name - The name that needs to be checked.
      Returns:
      True if and only if the input name only contains letters, capital or not, numbers, . , - or _ and has at least one character.

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Set the name to the given input name if the input name is valid.
      Parameters:
      name - Name that we want to call or file
      Postconditions:
      The file name only contains letters, capital or not, numbers, . , - or _ and contains at least one character. If the input name does not follow these rules, the file name will be "undefined".
